snippet: Edward Dolman, a former Christie’s chairman, is returning to the auction business as chairman and chief executive of Phillips.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; Edward Dolman, who is stepping down from Qatar Museum, will become chairman and chief executive of Phillips auction house; Sotheby's will auction sculpture of Popeye by artist Jeff Koons, which is estimated to bring around $25 million; image of quilt created by artist Faith Ringgold in 1986 and titled Groovin' Hight will fill billboard next to High Line beginning in May.
lead_paragraph: Edward Dolman, a former Christie’s chairman, is returning to the auction business as chairman and chief executive of Phillips.

headline.main: An Auctioneer Comes Back to the Business
headline.print_headline: An Auctioneer Comes Back to the Business
